replies.msg:
Manchester United have completed the signing of England starlet Wayne Rooney in a deal worth just short of pound 30 million.
The Red Devils have been brokering the move with Everton for the past few days, but they have finally concluded the biggest English deal of the summer.

“It was a tough decision to leave Everton, the club I’ve supported and played for all my life, but I’m excited to be joining a club as big as Manchester United,” said Rooney.

Sir Alex Ferguson added: “I am very excited, I think we have got the best young player this country has seen in the past 30 years. Everyone is delighted by this signing.”

Manchester United have completed the signing of England starlet Wayne Rooney in a deal worth just short of pound 30 million.

“It was a tough decision to leave Everton, the club I’ve supported and played for all my life, but I’m excited to be joining a club as big as Manchester United,” said Rooney.

Sir Alex Ferguson added: “I am very excited, I think we have got the best young player this country has seen in the past 30 years. Everyone is delighted by this signing.”

Timothy Fosu-Mensah wants to end Fulham loan from Manchester United early and move elsewhere

Timothy Fosu-Mensah, the Manchester United defender, wants to cut short his loan spell at Fulham and join another club until the end of the season.

Slavisa Jokanovic, the then Fulham manager, signed Fosu-Mensah on a season-long loan in August, but the 21-year-old has not been able to hold down a regular first-team place at the London club.

https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/timothy-fosu-mensah-wants-to-end-fulham-loan-from-manchester-united-early-and-move-elsewhere-vtr0k8l93

Timothy Fosu-Mensah wants to end Fulham loan from Manchester United early and move elsewhere

Timothy Fosu-Mensah, the Manchester United defender, wants to cut short his loan spell at Fulham and join another club until the end of the season.

Slavisa Jokanovic, the then Fulham manager, signed Fosu-Mensah on a season-long loan in August, but the 21-year-old has not been able to hold down a regular first-team place at the London club.

https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/timothy-fosu-mensah-wants-to-end-fulham-loan-from-manchester-united-early-and-move-elsewhere-vtr0k8l93

replies.msg:
Juan Mata admits he is unsure whether he will continue at Manchester United beyond the end of the season.

The midfielder, who is out of contract in the summer, told AS that he is “calm” even though he doesn’t know what the future holds.

“I don’t know," he said. "I've been in England for a good while, in a league that I'm well accustomed to and where I've adapted well, but it's true that at times you miss home, your family, your friends. But I don't know if I'll return to Spain in the near future.

"I'm calm. I'm at the fantastic club that is Manchester United, one of the biggest in the world.”

Manchester United have made a bid £54million (€60m)for Inter Milan defender Milan Skriniar, with the Red Devils still wanting to bolster a frail defensive line that has cost them at times this season despite their revived form of late.

Skriniar is a player that Jose Mourinho was interested in during his time in Manchester, and he tried to sign the 23-year old throughout the summer transfer window before the start of the 2018/19 season.
